sentence.Network_en: In a traditional Chinese family filial piety is rigidly observed.
sentence.Network_cn: 在传统的中国家庭里,人们恪守孝道.

sentence.Network_en: They were drawn to the church not by piety but by curiosity.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们去教堂不是出于虔诚而是出于好奇.

sentence.Network_en: Later I talked with Big Brother in his room about filial piety.
sentence.Network_cn: 饭后天还没有黑尽,我到大哥房里和他谈到孝的问题.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (in the sense 'devotion to religious observances'): from Old French piete, from Latin pietas 'dutifulness', from pius (See pious)

entry.def: Piety is strong religious belief, or behaviour that is religious or morally correct.

means.word_mean: 1. righteousness by virtue of being pious

Sentence.sentence: L) The college admission essay contains the grandest American themes―status anxiety, parental piety (孝顺), intellectual standards—and so it is only a matter of time before it becomes infected by the country's culture of excessive concern with self-esteem.

sentences.en: They were drawn to the church not by piety but by curiosity.
